main_text.sentence: Interestingly, anti-CYP2A6 autoantibodies were not detected in patients with AIH-2 who exhibit high titers of anti-LKM-1 autoantibodies [134].
Moreover, thyroid autoantibodies are rare in healthy centenarians [39].
Three types of anti-LKM autoantibodies have been identified [3,5,14,15,18,30,63,72,85].

source_text.title: Cytochrome P450 2A6: A new hepatic autoantigen in patients with chronic hepatitis C virus infection
Chronic active hepatitis associated with anti-liver kidney microsome antibody type I: A second type of "autoimmune hepatitis"

Human antiendoplasmic reticulum autoantibodies appearing in a drug-induced hepatitis directed against a human liver cytochrome P450 that hydroxylates the drug
